channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-19248] Protobuf code generate and replace should happen together
item.summary: Protobuf code generate and replace should happen together

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
pan3793 opened a new pull request, #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975

<!--
Thanks for sending a pull request!
1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HADOOP/How+To+Contribute
2. Make sure your PR title starts with JIRA issue id, e.g., 'HADOOP-17799. Your PR title ...'.
-->

      1. Description of PR

As part of HADOOP-16596, it switched from the vanilla protobuf to the shaded one, thus the generated code by `protobuf` should be modified (replace package name) before compiling and generating Javadoc.

Currently, the protobuf code generate happens in `generate-sources`(and other similar phases), while the replace happens in `process-sources`, this is OK for compiling but has problems for Javadoc.

```
$ mvn clean install -DskipTests
$ mvn javadoc:javadoc
```

The above commands won't trigger replace, thus the final generated Javadoc refers to vanilla protobuf.

<img width="1428" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/58dd666e-4c91-497c-ba7e-ffa272393378">

The `javadoc`(Java 8) also complains that

```
[INFO] -

pan3793 commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2265478907

there is no issue with `mvn package -Pdocs -DskipTests`, but I also suppose `mvn javadoc:javadoc` should work because it is listed at https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/c593c17255c06a32b01055e2f4bb2394009bd94a/BUILDING.txt#L148

slfan1989 commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2266279589

> cc @steveloughran @slfan1989 @aajisaka

Can we explain the difference between these two options?

> cc @steveloughran @slfan1989 @aajisaka

Thank you for contribution! Personally, I'm not sure if this modification is feasible; I noticed differences between these two options on Maven's lifecycle page. I need other members to help verify.

https://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-lifecycle.html

Phase|Description

pan3793 commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2268382423

also cc @vinayakumarb

steveloughran commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2273813010

Looking at the maven stuff I'd consider the replacement part of the generation. The problem we have is that within a life-cycle phase I am not sure we can guarantee that operations happen. Having no specific phases is designed to eliminate the ambiguity. As it is: even if it currently works for maven locally, do we have any guarantees that it will continue to work?

pan3793 commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2274308687

@steveloughran I understand your concerns, without explicitly setting dependencies between executions, the final execution set and order will always seem fragile.

> do we have any guarantees that it will continue to work?

According to https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/javadoc-mojo.html, `mvn javadoc:javadoc` would

> Invokes the execution of the following [lifecycle phase](https://maven.apache.org/ref/current/maven-core/lifecycles.html) prior to executing itself: `generate-sources`.

I think the answer is yes, assuming all executions within a goal run sequentially based on the declared order. (I didn't find such a statement in the Maven documentation, but it seems to be true)

slfan1989 commented on PR #6975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6975#issuecomment-2285979475

LGTM +1.

I’m currently organizing the JDK 17 build scripts and will verify this functionality again. Let's see if there are any other comments from other members. (wait an additional 1-2 days)

@pan3793 Thanks for the contribution! @steveloughran Thanks for the review!

pan3793 commented on PR #6975:
